item.title: Computer Science Colloquia: Utkarsh Ojha - On the creative potential of generative models and detecting their images | March 31
item.description: Date: Monday, March 31, 2025 11:00 AM - 12:00 PM in CII 3206 - Utkarsh Ojha is currently a postdoctoral fellow at Carnegie Mellon University. He received his Ph.D. in computer science from the University of Wisconsin-Madison. His research work has centered around generative models for images. He has developed algorithms that can enable those models to create new visual concepts not seen during training. As of late, his research focus has shifted to developing methods which can distinguish real and AI-generated images.

item.title: Marx, Mars, and Hyrule: Imagining Planetary Futures: Christian P. Haines to Speak on March 28
item.description: Friday, March 28, 4:30 - 6:00 PM, SAGE 3303: What do Marxism, science fiction, and video games have in common? They are all efforts to imagine what it’s like to live in complex planetary ecosystems. In this lecture, Christian P. Haines (Assoc. Prof. of English, Penn State) critically examines fantasies of terraforming as alibis for socioeconomic inequality and political injustice.

item.title: DotCIO - Update for Microsoft Office 365 Applications & Add-Ons
item.description: All 3rd party applications and add-ons used within Rensselaer’s Office 365 environment must be reviewed to ensure compliance with Rensselaer policies and requirements for data security, privacy, accessibility, and licensing.
